newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait says 98 pct of private sector workers expats.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait says 98 pct of private sector workers expats.

text.p: Foreign workers constitute 98.4 percent of the workforce in Kuwait's private sector, a minister was quoted on Tuesday as saying.
Planning Minister Ali al-Zmei'a said 9,828 Kuwaitis are employed by the private sector while 606,087 foreigners, 44 percent of whom unskilled workers, work for private businesses.
The minister gave the figures in a response to a parliamentary question, al-Rai al-Aaam newspaper reported.

Parliament has voiced concern over the jobs of Kuwaitis working in the public sector when the government privatises heavily subsidised utilities which are also used as employment centres for Kuwaitis.
Zmei'a said government plans include "encouraging the national workforce to join private business and support the private sector".

About 92.4 percent of Kuwait's national workforce is hired by the state which spends about two thirds of its annual oil revenue on wages of over 1.25 billion dinars ($4.18 billion) in the cradle-to-grave welfare state of about 720,000 Kuwaitis.
There are some 1.2 million foreigners in Kuwait.
Experts say Kuwaitis are difficult to employ in the private sector because the state guarantees them higher wages and generous benefits which private firms find hard to match.
